value.content:
[
  {
    "type": "deprecated_algorithm",
    "severity": "high",
    "algorithm": "SHA-1",
    "description": "SHA-1 is deprecated due to collision vulnerabilities. It should not be used for digital signatures or integrity verification.",
    "evidence": "SHA-1 initialization vectors found at 0xaec0, 0xaec8, 0xaec4, 0xaecc, 0xaed0",
    "recommendation": "Replace SHA-1 with SHA-256 or SHA-3 for all security-critical applications"
  },
  {
    "type": "deprecated_algorithm",
    "severity": "high", 
    "algorithm": "MD5",
    "description": "MD5 is deprecated due to significant collision vulnerabilities. It is considered cryptographically broken and unsafe for security purposes.",
    "evidence": "MD5 initialization constants found at 0xaec0, 0xaec8, 0xaec4, 0xaecc",
    "recommendation": "Replace MD5 with SHA-256 or SHA-3 for all hashing requirements"
  },
  {
    "type": "deprecated_algorithm",
    "severity": "critical",
    "algorithm": "RC4",
    "description": "RC4 is a deprecated stream cipher with known biases in its keystream that can lead to practical attacks.",
    "evidence": "RC4 initialization pattern at 0x144202, Key scheduling algorithm (KSA) pattern at 0x1c5",
    "recommendation": "Replace RC4 with modern stream ciphers like ChaCha20 or use AES in CTR mode"
  },
  {
    "type": "weak_key_size",
    "severity": "critical",
    "algorithm": "RSA",
    "description": "RSA implementation uses a weak key size of 1024 bits, which is vulnerable to factorization attacks.",
    "evidence": "RSA/ECC modulus detected at 0x9 with length 129 (1024-bit key)",
    "recommendation": "Upgrade to RSA-2048 or RSA-4096 key sizes. Consider using elliptic curve cryptography (ECC) with curves like Curve25519"
  }
]
